homebuyR 0.0.1
  • Reference

    Compute Remaining Principal Balance

    compute_principal_remaining.Rd

    Calculates the outstanding principal balance of a loan after a certain number of payments have been made. This is equivalent to the present value of the remaining future payments.

    compute_principal_remaining(
  monthly_payment,
  rate_per_month,
  n_payments_remaining
)

    Arguments

    monthly_payment

    Numeric. The fixed monthly payment amount. Must be non-negative.

    rate_per_month

    Numeric. The interest rate per month. Must be non-negative.

    n_payments_remaining

    Integer. The number of payments still remaining on the loan. Must be non-negative.

    Value

    Numeric. The calculated remaining principal balance.

    Examples

    # Calculate remaining principal on a $300k, 30yr, 6% APR loan after 5 years (60 payments made)
annual_rate <- 0.06
monthly_rate <- annual_rate / 12
payment <- compute_monthly_payment(300000, monthly_rate, 360) # approx 1798.65
payments_made <- 60
total_payments <- 360
remaining_payments <- total_payments - payments_made
compute_principal_remaining(monthly_payment = payment,
                            rate_per_month = monthly_rate,
                            n_payments_remaining = remaining_payments)
#> [1] 279163.1
# Expected output: approx 278719.03

# Remaining principal when 0 payments remain
compute_principal_remaining(monthly_payment = payment,
                            rate_per_month = monthly_rate,
                            n_payments_remaining = 0)
#> [1] 0
# Expected output: 0

# Remaining principal on a 0% loan after some payments
compute_principal_remaining(monthly_payment = 1000,
                            rate_per_month = 0,
                            n_payments_remaining = 6) # 6 payments left on a 12k loan
#> [1] 6000
# Expected output: 6000
